revised_title: On the Diameters of a Plane Cubic: A Geometric Analysis
tldr: This article investigates the properties of a plane cubic curve and its relation to the complex of lines, known as Newtonian diameters, which are the polars with respect to the points on any transversal. The author develops relations between the cubic curve and these lines, and explores their geometric significance, including the envelope of the complex, the poloid, and the centroid of the cubic.
